conversion_verification.notes: Second image is an angled cutaway 3D model with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible interior volume, multiple wall faces (top/side), and ceiling removed to expose rooms.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion and readable volumetric rooms; clean cutaway. Minor simplification in wall-top/corner detailing in some areas.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout matches: living/dining left, kitchen top-left, utility top-right, toilet near center-top, bedroom right, balcony bottom-left. Adjacencies largely correct. Some openings (doors/windows) are simplified and not all placements/sizes are fully verifiable from the render.

interior_elements.notes: Living (sofas, table), bedroom (bed), and kitchen cabinetry are present. Utility element appears included. Bathroom/toilet fixtures are not clearly modeled/visible, reducing fidelity.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is clean and readable with good separation of walls/floors; lighting is adequate. Some interior details (especially bathroom) are too minimal to confirm fine accuracy.

detected_errors.description: Doors/windows/openings are simplified; not all opening positions and proportional sizes can be confirmed to match the 2D plan.
Bathroom/toilet fixtures are missing or not clearly visible, reducing room identity verification.
Slight proportional simplifications (wall lengths/room shapes) appear in the 3D compared to the dimensioned 2D plan, though major adjacencies remain correct.

summary: A true cutaway 3D conversion with strong volumetric correctness and largely faithful layout, with minor losses in opening detail and bathroom fixture representation.
